page.title: 05Riverlands Farm (mixed farm)
page.content: On Monday 17th June our school went to Riverlands farm. Mr Burton showed us around . There are 300 acres of land. Mr Burton's farm is arable and livestock. He has two and a half workers. He grows 4 main things, barley, wheat, rape and beans. He has 170 cattle that he breeds for beef. Altogether he has 550 cattle a year. Mr Burton has a Limousin bull which is 13 months old and weighs 460kg. The cows eat 70% barley 20% wheat and the rest are minerals. Cattle now put on more weight because there is better food than a few years ago and they get fed more. The food is always there because the farmers keep it in a bucket and let the cows get it when they want it. The new breeds of cattle are Romagnola and Charolais. They don't keep the old breeds because they have too much fat on their meat.
